page.title: 09NATURAL HISTORY (iii)
page.content: Absence of herbicides in this area ensures a wealth of flowers in the hedgerows. On July 17th 54 different flowers were found in one short stretch of lane.Even to the non-specialist the lanes resemble a garden. May banks are vivid with pink campion,white stitchwort and bluebells , whilst in June foxgloves stand in the the hedges which later froth with giant white convolvulus and bedstraw; spikes of pennywort and sheepsbit scabious star the banks. In Spring wild daffodils may be found near Week Down, and several kinds of orchids. {Trees}are chiefly oak,ash,sycamore, hazel,holly,rowan,birch and beech. {Ferns}are a notable feature,most commonly lady fern,male fern,hard fern common polypody,hart's tongue, maidenhair spleenwort and broad buckler fern.
